title: Testing Times for the Contact Centre and Semantics

author: Christopher Baker, University of New Brunswick

OK, so in the contact center the major business challenge is obviously answering calls that are routed to different agents.
There is essentially a very lengthy diagnosis phase where people have to very quickly identify a problem and get it to the right people, and there's very little time.
For troubleshooting and we find that the agents themselves end up spending maybe 25 to 50% of the time just looking for the right information to look up the knowledge that they want to deliver.
And of course, this is in a variety of different formats and silos.
This is very close to the problems that the semantic web technologies are trying to solve.
And one of the biggest challenges in the time frame that the initial Tier 1 agents actually have about a 5 minute time frame to try and deliver an answer to the to the to the client on the telephone.
And if they cannot do this within the time frame the calls get booted up to the second tier.
And there's a lot less people in the second tier to answer questions.
So that the cases actually languish and very slow in getting response time.
